name: R5-IssueType-R4-IssueType
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 IssueType into a FHIR R4 IssueType

element.display: The content/operation failed to pass some business rule and so could not proceed.

target.display: The content/operation failed to pass some business rule and so could not proceed.

element.display: The code or system could not be understood, or it was not valid in the context of a particular ValueSet.code.

target.display: The code or system could not be understood, or it was not valid in the context of a particular ValueSet.code.

element.display: Content could not be accepted because of an edit conflict (i.e. version aware updates). (In a pure RESTful environment, this would be an HTTP 409 error, but this code may be used where the conflict is discovered further into the application architecture.).

target.display: Content could not be accepted because of an edit conflict (i.e. version aware updates). (In a pure RESTful environment, this would be an HTTP 409 error, but this code may be used where the conflict is discovered further into the application architecture.).

element.display: The reference pointed to content (usually a resource) that has been deleted.

target.display: The reference pointed to content (usually a resource) that has been deleted.

element.display: An attempt was made to create a duplicate record.

target.display: An attempt was made to create a duplicate record.

element.display: An unexpected internal error has occurred.

target.display: An unexpected internal error has occurred.

element.display: User session expired; a login may be required.

target.display: User session expired; a login may be required.

element.display: An extension was found that was not acceptable, could not be resolved, or a modifierExtension was not recognized.

target.display: An extension was found that was not acceptable, could not be resolved, or a modifierExtension was not recognized.

element.display: The user does not have the rights to perform this action.

target.display: The user does not have the rights to perform this action.

element.display: Not all data sources typically accessed could be reached or responded in time, so the returned information might not be complete (applies to search interactions and some operations).

target.display: Not all data sources typically accessed could be reached or responded in time, so the returned information might not be complete (applies to search interactions and some operations).

element.display: A message unrelated to the processing success of the completed operation (examples of the latter include things like reminders of password expiry, system maintenance times, etc.).

target.display: A message unrelated to the processing success of the completed operation (examples of the latter include things like reminders of password expiry, system maintenance times, etc.).

element.display: Content invalid against the specification or a profile.

target.display: Content invalid against the specification or a profile.

element.display: A content validation rule failed - e.g. a schematron rule.

target.display: A content validation rule failed - e.g. a schematron rule.

element.display: Some search filters might not have applied on all results.  Data may have been included that does not meet all of the filters listed in the `self` `Bundle.link`.
A resource/record locking failure (usually in an underlying database).

target.display: A resource/record locking failure (usually in an underlying database).

element.display: The client needs to initiate an authentication process.

target.display: The client needs to initiate an authentication process.

element.display: Multiple matching records were found when the operation required only one match.

target.display: Multiple matching records were found when the operation required only one match.

element.display: The persistent store is unavailable; e.g. the database is down for maintenance or similar action, and the interaction or operation cannot be processed.

target.display: The persistent store is unavailable; e.g. the database is down for maintenance or similar action, and the interaction or operation cannot be processed.

element.display: The reference provided was not found. In a pure RESTful environment, this would be an HTTP 404 error, but this code may be used where the content is not found further into the application architecture.

target.display: The reference provided was not found. In a pure RESTful environment, this would be an HTTP 404 error, but this code may be used where the content is not found further into the application architecture.

element.display: The interaction, operation, resource or profile is not supported.

target.display: The interaction, operation, resource or profile is not supported.

element.display: Processing issues. These are expected to be final e.g. there is no point resubmitting the same content unchanged.

target.display: Processing issues. These are expected to be final e.g. there is no point resubmitting the same content unchanged.

element.display: A required element is missing.

target.display: A required element is missing.

element.display: An authentication/authorization/permissions issue of some kind.

target.display: An authentication/authorization/permissions issue of some kind.

element.display: A structural issue in the content such as wrong namespace, unable to parse the content completely, invalid syntax, etc.

target.display: A structural issue in the content such as wrong namespace, unable to parse the content completely, invalid syntax, etc.

element.display: The operation completed successfully.

Some information was not or might not have been returned due to business rules, consent or privacy rules, or access permission constraints.  This information may be accessible through alternate processes.

target.display: Some information was not or might not have been returned due to business rules, consent or privacy rules, or access permission constraints.  This information may be accessible through alternate processes.

element.display: The system is not prepared to handle this request due to load management.

target.display: The system is not prepared to handle this request due to load management.

element.display: An internal timeout has occurred.

target.display: An internal timeout has occurred.

element.display: The operation was stopped to protect server resources; e.g. a request for a value set expansion on all of SNOMED CT.

target.display: The operation was stopped to protect server resources; e.g. a request for a value set expansion on all of SNOMED CT.

element.display: Provided content is too long (typically, this is a denial of service protection type of error).

target.display: Provided content is too long (typically, this is a denial of service protection type of error).

element.display: Transient processing issues. The system receiving the message may be able to resubmit the same content once an underlying issue is resolved.

target.display: Transient processing issues. The system receiving the message may be able to resubmit the same content once an underlying issue is resolved.

element.display: The user or system was not able to be authenticated (either there is no process, or the proferred token is unacceptable).

target.display: The user or system was not able to be authenticated (either there is no process, or the proferred token is unacceptable).

element.display: An element or header value is invalid.

target.display: An element or header value is invalid.
